Speaker: second voice
Dialogue: Why don't we blast 'im, for Christ sake, he ain't gonna come down... you...

Speaker: warren
Dialogue: You goin' t'see the Big White Fathuh?

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: He goin' t'see the Big White Muthuh...

Speaker: miss pilbow
Dialogue: Good morning, Miss Ratched. It's a beautiful day, isn't it?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Mean old Monday, Miss Pilbow, mean old Monday...  Good morning, boys. Rise and shine. Rise and shine.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Good morning, Mister Sefelt... Good morning, Mister Fredrickson. Good morning, Billy, I spoke to your mother last night and she sends her love... Good morning, Mister Harding... Good morning, Mister Cheswick. Mister Scanlon...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Mister Washington, why don't we get a good head start on the day by shaving Mister Bromden and see if we can't avoid a disturbance.

Speaker: miss pilbow
Dialogue: Eighty-two, Miss Pilbow speaking... Yes...  ... New admission, Miss Ratched...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I tell ya, these goons showered me at the courthouse this morning, last night at the jail, and I swear they'd have swabbed my ears out on the way over if they could've found the facilities...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ya know, I ain't never been in an institution of psychology before.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm here on a ninety-day observation period. Short-timer, like they say...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Man, there sure is an awful lot of poontang around here.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Why, I'll betcha there must be a million albacore and tuna running of the coast right this minute.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Oh, do you do much fishing?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Fish! Hell, Doc, I'd like to have a nickel for every fish I landed between Point Conception and the Alaska coast...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yup! Worked right outta Depoe Bay for just about every season since I was able to haul my own weight.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: My, my... Ah, who are you?

Speaker: nurse pilbow
Dialogue: Mister McMurphy is a new admission.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Ah, yes. Well, we must talk soon, Mister McMurphy.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Good morning, Jim. How are you feeling?

Speaker: miss pilbow
Dialogue: Make yourself at home, Mister McMurphy...

Speaker: martini
Dialogue: Can you borrow me a dime?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Sorry, buddy, I'm clean outta change...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, how's it look up there, big boy?

Speaker: scanlon
Dialogue: He can't hear you. He's just a deaf and dumb Indian!

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: I want you to write me a letter to my brother for a hundred dollars to bury me.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You look pretty healthy to me.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hell, compared to where I just come from, this is a country club.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shoot! No wonder you don't care nothin' 'bout showin' your hand.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, put 'er there, Billy boy, my name's McMurphy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What I wanna know is who's the top loony around here?

Speaker: cheswick
Dialogue: Yeah, do you have an appointment?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm seeing what a busy man does.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Well, if you gentlemen will excuse me, I have some pressing matters to attend to.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yessir, that's why I came to this establishment for, to bring you birds fun and entertainment 'round the gamin' table...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Easy now, don't smudge 'em, we got lots of games ahead of us...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hold the fort down, will ya, fellas!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: My name is Miss Ratched. I'm the head nurse here. You've already met Miss Pilbow and Aides Washington and Warren.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: We do appreciate the way you have taken it upon yourself to meet the other patients.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: This is your bed. You may leave your things in that cabinet.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Please use your time to familiarize yourself with your new home and if there is anything you need to know, don't hesitate to ask us.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, I sure would like to call my aunt up in Portland and tell 'er where I am so she can come visit me.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Just that I'm glad to be here, Miss Ratched. I really am.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, you ain't half so bad looking for a head nurse.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Yes. Now go along, Mister McMurphy. Go along.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am.  Lead the way, Sam.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hell, Doc, I've been everything from a hoopla man with a two-bit carny show to a top mechanic and bull goose catskinner for every gypo loggin' operation in the Northwest till the Army taught me what my natural bent was.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, but you know how society persecutes a dedicated man.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: They say I'm a habitual hassler. Like I fight some. Sheeut. They didn't mind so much when I was a dumb logger and got into a hassle. That's a hardworkin' feller blowing off steam, they say. But if you're a gambler, all you have to do is spit slantwise and you're a goddamned criminal.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: To tell the truth, ever since I found my natural callin' I done time in so many small-time jails I could write a brochure...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, ya know, Doc...  Doesn't it say so there?

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: The doctor at the prison states: 'Don't overlook the possibility that this man may be faking psychosis to escape the drudgery of the work farm...' What do you say to that?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Doc, what can I tell ya?

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Ah, it seems you have no other psychiatric history, Mister Murphy?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: No, this is my first trip, Doc.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Well, you're here for a ninety-day observation period, Mister McMurphy. I'd like you to understand you are here on a court order and we are responsible to the state. So, I'd like your cooperation!

Speaker: bancini
Dialogue: I'm tired. Whew. O Lord. Oh, I'm awful tired...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Somebody please see to Mister Bancini, so we can start the meeting.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: At the close of Friday's meeting, we were discussing Mister Harding's problem, concerning his wife...  Mister Harding stated that his wife made him uneasy because she drew stares from men on the street. Is that correct, Mister Harding?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: So. Does anyone care to touch upon this further?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, well, it just pains me somethin' awful to see a full growed man sloshing around in his own water...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Yes... We were discussing Mister Harding's problem with his wife. Now, who will start?  Billy.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Yes, Miss Ratched, this is correct.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I can only speculate as to the reasons why.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Have you ever speculated, Mister Harding, that you are impatient with your wife because she does not meet your mental requirements?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Miss Ratched. Given all the conditions of that sublime relationship, coupled with the subsequent annihilation of all that I held to be sacred, mentally, physically and emotionally, the only thing that I can speculate on, at this late date, is how I will justify the very existence of my life, with or without my dear wife.

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, Harding, why don't you knockoff the bullshit and get to the point.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: The point is, I will carry on until I fully understand what the function of that relationship is regardless of form or content.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I-I-I-I-I d-d-don't s-s-see how anyone could lu-lu-lu-love a man who t-t-t-talks the way he does.

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, Harding, you're so fuckin' dumb I can't believe it.

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: Yeah, Harding, where do you breathe anyway?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Is that your sense of humor or are you trying to say something?

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: Now what would I be trying to say?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't know, but it makes me feel very peculiar when you throw in something like that.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: No secrets, Mister Harding. Let's get it all out in the open...

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I mean, the other day you made an allusion to my wife and the possible sexual problems we might be having. I know that to be the case, but the way in which you broached it, if that's your idea of teaching me something...

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: You know what, Harding? I think you're some kind of morbid asshole or something. You've been talking about your wife evere since I can remember. You know, she's on your mind and blah, blah, blah and on and on and when are you going to wise up and turn her loose!

Speaker: acutes
Dialogue: Yeah, who do you think you are anyway?... He thinks he's God Almighty... He's a snob... He's a schmuck... Dumbbell... Creep... Cretin... Idiot... Get rid of him... Ship him upstairs...

Speaker: acutes
Dialogue: Zap him... Give 'im lobotomy... Cut his nuts off... He doesn't have any... Fag... Pervert.

Speaker: bancini
Dialogue: Tired. Tired. Oh God, I'm tired...

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: You a good boy, Mistah Bancini...

Speaker: bancini
Dialogue: You see... it's a lotta baloney... It's all a lotta baloney...

Speaker: nurse pilbow
Dialogue: Yes, yes, Mister Bancini, now if you'll just be calm...

Speaker: bancini
Dialogue: That's all it is, just a lotta baloney. Ya see, I can't help it, can't...

Speaker: bancini
Dialogue: ... don't ya see. I was born dead. Not you. You wasn't born dead. Ahhh, it's been so hard...  Tired... I'm tired... aw-ful tired...

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: Martini, there ain't nobody there, ya dumb goon! Go get the ball!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, say, buddy, is that the usual pro-cedure for those Group Ther'py shindigs? Bunch of chickens at a peckin' party?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: That's right, buddy. And you want to know who pecks the first peck?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ah, come off it! It's that Big Nurse, that's who...

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: It's as simple as that. You've been on our ward six hours and have already simplified the work of Freud, Jung and Maxwell Jones in one grand analogy: it's a pecking party.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm not talking about Fred Yoong or Maxwell Jones, buddy, what I'm talkin' about is that crummy meeting and what that nurse did to you!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Did to you and all the rest of you guys.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Y-y-yes! Yes! Y-y-y-you s-s-saw wh wh-what she c-c-can do to us!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What did I see 'cept a grown man gettin' whipped so bad he can't laugh anymore.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Tell 'er to go straight to hell!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Miss Ratched is a competent psychiatric nurse, not some, some kind of monster pecking out our eyes!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: She ain't peckin' at your eyes, buddy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: She's peckin' at your balls, buddy, at your ever-lovin' balls.

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: That kind of behavior will get you a P.A. rating, my friend.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: P.A. What the hell is that?

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: Which gets you shipped up to Disturbed for a nice little zap job.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Electro-Shock Therapy, my friend. Five cents' worth of electricity and you are out of everybody's hair.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Tell 'er to go to hell anyway!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Is that your sense of humor or are you tryin' to say somethin'?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Now, what would I be trying to say?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Back and forth, that's it. Shoot, man, we'll be takin' on the New York Knicks before we're through...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hit, you say? Well well well and with a king up, the boy wants a hit. Whadaya know. So comin' at you and too bad, a little lady for the lad and he's over the wall and down the road, up the hill and dropped his load.

Speaker: cheswick
Dialogue: She won't give me any more cigarettes!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: That okay. I'll take your marker. How many ya want?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, all bets are down, let's wheel 'em an' deal 'em.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Big king... little deuce... another king... a lovely lady... big ten... and a trey... hey, hey, whadaya say? Ya hit or sit, Martini?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, Taber, who's pitching the opening game?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Wait a minute, Martini, I can't hear a thing.  What?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Pardon me miss, but would you mind turning...

Speaker: nurse pilbow
Dialogue: Stay back! Patients aren't allowed to enter the... Oh, stay back!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Mister McMurphy. Patients aren't allowed in here.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Pardon me, ma'am, can I ask you somethin'?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: How 'bout turning off that music for a while so a man can hear himself think?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: That music is for everyone, Mister McMurphy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, say, how 'bout easin' it down a bit so a man don't have to shout!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What's the horse pill for, honey?

Speaker: nurse pilbow
Dialogue: It's just medication, Mister McMurphy, good for you. Now down it goes...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Look, miss, I don't like swallowing something without knowing what it is!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm not upset. All I wanna know, for the lovva Jesus...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: That's all right, Miss Pilbow, if Mister McMurphy does not wish to take his medication orally, he may...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: No, that's okay, ma'am. Down it goes.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell her to go to hell, lover boy?

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, whattsa matter, Mack, she too much for ya?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You boys seem to think you've got a champ in there, huh?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I don't see you scoring any points, buddy. And you're just the man for the job, right?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hell, I couldn't get it up over old hatchet-face if ya paid me!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Le's get back to bed, Mistah Bromden...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Oh, does the spearmint lose its flavor on the bedpost overnight? When you chew it in the morning, will it be too hard to bite? This question's got me goin', won't somebody set me right; does the spearmint lose its flavor on the bedpost overnight?

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: Le's go, Chief. Le's go get ourselves all nice and clean...  You too, Mistah Mack-Murphy!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Who the fuck stole my cigarettes!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Good morning, Mister Sefelt, are your teeth any better?... Good morning, Mister Fredrickson... Good morning, Mister Harding; my, my, you've been biting your fingernails again...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, some creep stole my cigarettes!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Now you boys hurry along and wash up for breakfast...  You too, Mister McMurphy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, say. How 'bout springing a pack of cigarettes loose?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: After breakfast, Mister McMurphy, after breakfast.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You sure run a tight-assed ship 'round here, don't ya!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Yes. Now run along like a good boy and see that you wash up properly.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, let's go brush our teeth, fellas...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Oh, Lulu had a baby, His name was Sunny Jim, She put 'im in a piss pot, To teach 'im how to swim. Oh, he swam to the bottom, He swam to the top, Lulu got excited, An' pulled 'im by his... Cock-tail ginger-ale, Five cents a glass, An' if ya don't like it Ya can shove it up your... Ask me no more questions, I'll tell ya no more lies.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Why, if I'd have known how soft this place was gonna be, I'd have arranged for my transfer sooner...  All this place lacks is a couple of sweet gals to liven things up...

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: Nobody leaves here till seven thirty.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Don't know if I can hold it that long, Sam.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Who do you like in the opening game, Sam?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Good...  Now, as I recall, we were making quite a bit of headway, last time, with Mister Harding's problem. So, does anyone care to begin?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Right... I've been givin' some serious consideration to what you told me about the democratic something of this therapeutic community of ours, an' I got a few things I wanna get off my chest, before we get back to Harding's problem.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay... Item one... I've been thinkin' 'bout the age problem we got on this ward. You know, the young an' old livin' together, an' I was thinkin' what a great thing it would be if the music was turned up louder. Louder so the old fellas could hear better...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: But then I got to thinkin', the music is so loud already, it makes it difficult for the young fellas to hold a decent conversation...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, I was turnin' this dilemma over in my head, when I happened to hit on that old tub room out there, an' I said to myself, McMurphy, I said, that place would make a great second day room. A sort of game room for the young fellas. Whadaya think, Doc?

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: It is worth considering... Miss Ratched?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: The point is well taken, Doctor, but do we have the necessary personnel to cover a second day room?

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Well, since it will be largely the Chronics who remain here, one aide and one nurse should easily be able to handle any situation that might occur.  What do you think, men, is it workable?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Good. Good. Yes, yes, I think we should give it a trial period. So! May we get back to Mister Harding's problem...  Yes, Mister McMurphy?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, item two. Tomorrow, and listen carefully to me, you ding-a lings. Tomorrow is the opening game of the World Series an' what I want is to take a vote on switchin' the group meetin' to later on in the day, so we can watch the ballgame.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: The hell with the schedule, you can get back to the schedule next week when the series is over. What I want is a vote on it right now!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Very well! All those in favor, please raise your hands.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on', what is this crap? Who wants to watch the World Series?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Then I suggest we turn our attention back to Mister Harding's problem. Would anybody care to begin?

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Yes, thank you, Miss Ratched. Since our last meeting I have been reflecting, quite seriously, on the nature of my problem. Naturally, I'm referring to the capacity to obtain the necessary results in order to obtain... No, no. To personify the very existence of that relationship regardless of the function...  Regardless of the function, we will confront the question of... Yes. Yes. The question of... Existence... Relationship... Function... Confront... Yes, confronting us in the moment of deepest crisis... Yes, the crisis of our souls. Of our souls, which I am trying to fully understand the problem... the problem. Not to shut ourselves off, but somehow... Somehow to understand fully our capacity... to obtain... to personify... the question... existence depends... depends on the question... to reflect... to reflect...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You need four houses on every lot of the same color, Martini. Now let's go, for Christsakes.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Snake eyes! Hoooeee, that puts you on my Marvin Gardens, which means you owe me three hundred and fifty dollars.

Speaker: martini
Dialogue: What's thum other things? Hold it a minute. What's thum other things all over the board?

Speaker: cheswick
Dialogue: How can a man concentrate with you sitting there hallucinating a mile a minute...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You just come on with that three fifty and Martini will take care of himself... Your dice, Scanlon.

Speaker: scanlon
Dialogue: Gimme those dice. I'll blow this board to pieces. Here we go...  Lebenty leben, count me over eleven, Martini...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Break it up, God dammit! Ain't I got enough troubles without you guys messin' around... can't depend on nobody.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Some of us ha-ha-have b-b-been here a long t-t-time, Randle, and will b b-be here long after this Wo-Wo World Series of yours is oh-oh-oh, what's the use anyway...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What's the use! Hooee! It'd do you birds some good just to get a little exercise lifting your arms to vote!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: A baseball game isn't worth the risk, my friend.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: It is to me! An' if I hafta bust way outta this place to see it, I will!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, how much you wanna bet?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: That me an' my buddy, Cheswick, we'll be downtown tomorrow watchin' the ballgame while you suckers are sittin' around this goddamn nursery!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: And how do you propose to accomplish that little feat, my friend?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: That's between me an' myself. So why don't you boys just shove off. I got some planning to do.

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: Maybe he'll just show Miss Ratched his big thing an' she'll open the door for him.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Maybe I'll just use that thick skull of yours as a batterin' ram, Sefelt.

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, you don't know how to get outta this place!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Put your money where your mouth is, Taber.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You want me to show ya! You want me to show ya how!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: With this thing! I'm gonna put this thing right through the window, that's how!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: You mean you're going to try to pick that thing up and shove it through the window?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You heard me the first time!

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: I'll bet a buck you don't do it!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: M-M-Mack, y-y-y-you c-c-can't l-l lift that thing!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Stand aside, son. Any more takers?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah... Okay, stand aside, you guys! You're usin' up my oxygen!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: But I tried. Goddammit, I sure as hell did that much. Didn't I?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: No, kid, it was my own stupidity, that's what pissed me off.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What we're gonna have to do is pull this ballclub together for our next play. 'Kay!

Speaker: washington's pov
Dialogue: Way down the hall, the Group Meeting is SEEN in progress.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I-I-I-I c-c-c-came over S-S-S Sunday m-m-m-morning after ch-ch-ch church and br-br-brought her s-s some flowers, and I s-s-said, I said, 'C-C-C-Celia, will you muh muh-muh-muh-muh...' till the girl broke out l-l-laughing.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: What was it about her that disturbed you so, Billy?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I was in luh-love with her.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Billy, were you afraid of her, or of her love?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, the man doesn't want to talk, so get off his back an' let's get on to some new business.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, the hell with that crap! The World Series is goin' on right' now an' that's therapy also!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What the hell does that have to do with it? This is an important event and I want a vote on it!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Will one more vote satisfy you?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm proposing a re-vote on watchin' the ballgame!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Okay, I wanna see the hands. I wanna see which of you birds has any guts.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, I count only eight.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You mean to tell me you're gonna count those old birds over there?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: B-But, M-M-Miss R-Ratched, y-you n never c-c-counted th-their votes before!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: You mean you don't want their votes to count, Billy!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hoo-wee! Man, all I need me now is a can of beer and a red-hot.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hoo-wee! Whatta game! Whatta game! Come on, Koufax! Strike 'em out!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: He's into his wind-up. Here comes the pitch. Strike on the inside corner!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: He's into his wind-up. Here's the next pitch... and it's a hit! It's a hit!

Speaker: martini
Dialogue: I saw thum! I saw thum!

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: Yes, I see it! I see it!

Speaker: acutes
Dialogue: Ya-hoo! It's a hit! A triple! It's a home run! A double! He's out! Whadaya blind? He's safe by a mile!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, it's two outs, bases loaded as Koufax steps up to the mound... Checks the runners... goes into his wind-up... Here comes the three-two pitch... And it's a fly ball into deep center. Mantle is going back. He's going back! Back! His back is up against the wall... and... he catches it! He catches it!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Just fine, Doc... In fact, I think I might've put on a couple of pounds since I got here.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Good, good, and how are you getting along on the ward?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, Doc, you know as well as I do what's been comin' down in that loony bin.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shoot, Doc, the only one I'm disturbing is that old nurse and her fixed ways. That's all.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, Doc, you must be kiddin'.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Jesus, that old nurse sure wants my ass in a sling, don't she!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Guidance and assistance! That's insane! Doc, ya gotta help me.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Okay, Chief. This is your spot! I don't want you to move from this spot! Never!... 'Kay, now, take the ball! Raise your hands, like this...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: That's good! That's a good boy, Chief! Now jump and put it in!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I know, goddammit! You don't have ta tell me that!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm not talkin' to him! I'm talkin' to myself! It helps me think!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, it doesn't hurt him either!  Jump! An' put it in!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Well, I think you're just confusing him...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ha! Did ya see that!  Hey, Cheswick!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Let me get on your shoulders.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, wheel me around to the basket... 'Kay, easy, easy. Hold it! 'Kay, now.  Hey, Chief, come back!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Now, wheel me to the basket.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Heh, heh, I'll show 'em who's crazy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, Billy. Billy boy, wake up and say goodbye to your ol' buddy.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhhh. See ya around the ball park.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: So long, Freddy. Don't take any wooden nickles.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhh... That's for me to know an' you to find out.

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Bullshit. You ain't got no way out!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You're on.  Let's go! An' keep it quiet.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Out. It's the way out. So just keep it in your minds if ya ever wanna make use of it.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhh. Wait a minute. You guys are gonna screw up my plans. So just gone on back to bed like nothin' happened.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhh. Hold it down! I'll take you guys down, but ya gotta come right back up! 'Kay?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhh... Remember this is a privilege, so I don't want none of you goons fuckin' up. Kay?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: 'Kay, let's see...  Cheswick first ... then Billy... Martini... Scanlon... Sefelt... Fredrickson... Taber an' the Chief... 'Kay

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Charlie, ya can't ever let those goons outta ya sight! Understand!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, Martini! Psst! Scanlon! Ya dumb goons, come back here!  Come on, let's get 'em!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, you guys, let's stick together.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I-I-I th-th-think we sh-sh-should go back!

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: Yeah, my feet are gettin' cold.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: We'll go back just as soon as we find those guys! 'Kay?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, don't crap out on me now. We got two buddies out there!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Well, shoot, man! Whadaya say we take ourselves a little spin around the place.

Speaker: cheswick
Dialogue: Yeah, maybe we ought to go back, Mac...

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, take us back to the dumbwaiter, Mac.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm not going back in there. I told ya this was a one way trip. Now stand aside.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Your horses are hungry, That's what she did say, Come sit down beside me, An' feed them some hay. My horses ain't hungry, They wontt eat your hay-ay-aeee...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I dunno. Where do ya wanna go?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Breakfast! Hell, I know just the place where we can chow down an' thaw out before we shoot back on home. 'Kay?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Soo, fare-the-weel, darlin'. I'm gone on my way, My wagons are loaded, My whip's in my hand...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on in an' warm up. You can put some of that gear on to keep warm. An' there's beer an' Coke in the cooler an' some food over here...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, don't be shy now, you're among friends.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Why don't one of you boys help ol' Chief there get warmed up?

Speaker: cheswick
Dialogue: When do you think we'll be going back, Mack?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come here a minute, Cheswick. You, too, Sefelt. Hey, all you guys, come over here, I wanna show you somethin'.

Speaker: martini
Dialogue: Oh, look at the pretty boat.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ease up on the star drag, keep the tie up, up and work hell outta that fella.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Up, I told you! Keep that tip up... up! You had you one big silver there.

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: We'll never get that on the boat.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: He's a big flounder. Could weigh two, three hundred. You got to lift him in with a winch.

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: Does that mean we have to cut him loose?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Like hell we will! We got the muscle standing right here. All we need is a couple gaffin' hooks and some rope.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: All right! Stand to! Stand to!

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Here they are, Miss Ratched. Safe and sound!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Good. Well, boys, did you enjoy yourselves?

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: Show her the one you caught, Jim.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, ya should've come along with us, Miss Ratched, an' gotten a little sun on your cheeks and maybe caught a fish or two.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Mr. McMurphy, you had no right to take these men out with you!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, that's kind of crazy, ain't it!

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: I thought I might donate it to the mess hall.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I'm not running a charity ward...

Speaker: martini
Dialogue: All gone! All gone! Don't hit! Don't hit!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I'm sure sorry, ma'am. Gawd, but I am. That window glass was so clean I didn't even see it...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You guys want cigarettes! Here's the goddamn cigarettes!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Goddammit, you sly son-of-a-bitch! Does anybody else know?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shit! This is too much!  Chief, I tell you we're gonna bust outta this place an' make it all the way to Canada before they know what bit 'em.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, well, well, well. 'Bout time the rest of the world got a gander at Big Chief Bromden cuttin' down the boulevard, stopping just long enough for virgins... Oh, man, I tell you, I tell you, you'll have women trippin' you and beating you to the floor...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Shhh, Chief, don't talk. Never talk! Remember, this is just between you an' me. Do ya understand?

Speaker: nurse itsu
Dialogue: Fine, thank you.  Here, please take these.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You know, I never got your name.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You comin' in to hold my hand?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah... Well, see ya around, Itsu.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: You boys can take a cigarette break now...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: That's all right, Mister McMurphy, just climb on the bed and lie down...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: This won't hurt you at all...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Surely, goodness and mercy will follow this, eh, honey?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Please, put this in your mouth...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: It's been brought to my attention that you're giving Mister Fredrickson your medication, aren't you, Mister Sefelt?

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: It's the Dilantin that makes my gums soft!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Now, Jim, you must be honest with yourself.

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: I wanna know why the dorm has to be locked in the daytime and on weekends?

Speaker: taber
Dialogue: Yeah, why can't a fellow even have the weekends to himself?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Sit down, Mister Cheswick, and wait your turn!

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: So what? Is it a mortal sin? I mean, normal people get to sleep late on weekends...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: With few exceptions, time spent in the company of others is therapeutic, while every minute spent brooding alone only increases separation.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I got ten thousand watts and hot to trot. First woman takes me on is gonna light up like a pinball machine an' pay off in silver dollars...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Just fine, Billy boy, just fine. Full of piss an' vinegar! They checked my plugs and cleaned my points...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ma'am, I'm as gentle as a puppy dog. Why, I haven't licked the tar out of an aide for two weeks! Hi ya, Doc!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Why, thank you, ma'am...  I figured as much...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: W-W-We h-heard y-you w-were n-never c-c-coming back!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, well, let me tell ya somethin'... While I was up there gettin' in-lightened, I came up with one hellava plan...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Plan?... Oh, yeah, the plan... Yeah...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Miss Ratched, would you please save a space for my aunt? She's comin' down from Portland.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, Sam, bet ya two bucks ya lose.

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: Shit, man, tha' ain't even worth considerin'.

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Me? I didn't hear a thing! Let's play ball!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, wake up, you ding-a-lings. The game is on.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Pass the ball, Harding...  Pass it, goddammit!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ya deaf! I said pass the ball!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: What are you talking about??? Everybody was covered!!! Everybody was covered!!!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I was open! Come on, let's play ball!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: What kind of crap is that???

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Pass it! Pass it! I'm open, McMurphy, pass the ball!

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Mack, you sonofabitch, you ol' fucker, how've you been?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Okay, Mack!  Whoowe, Candy girl, are we in an insane asylum or ain't we?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: How's your ass been holdin' up, honey?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, girls, we're holding up the game!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Miss Ratched, this is my Aunt Candy and her friend Rose...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Miss Ratched was kind enough to save you ladies a seat...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Talk to ya at half time!

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Oh, just those guys dressed in white?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: No, miss, it's the other way around.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Whadaya doin', there's no one there!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Okay, Martini. That's okay. Now you watch me.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Miss, it's a complicated case. It would take too long to explain.

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Yeah, well, he looks like hell!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Billy, it's not polite to stare!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ya fuckin' coon, you're not on the ward now!

Speaker: spivey
Dialogue: Break it up, boys!  Point counts. One free throw!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: We got your black ass now, Washington, wanna bet another twenty?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: What you boys doin' up at this ungodly time o' the night?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: I thought I told you boys to go to bed!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Our prayers have been answered, Turkle! Our prayers have been answered!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I tell ya, there's an angel of mercy standing out there, Turkle.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Hallelujah, brother, now get back in bed!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: That angel of mercy, he ain't a she, is he?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Now, wouldn't you pray for twenty bucks, a bottle booze an' a piece of that angel cake?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Ah'm on my knees, brother, ah'm on my knees.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Man, you look good 'nough to eat!

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Yeah, well you look like hell warmed over...

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Hey, Mac! Gimme a hand, will ya!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Shhh... let's move it away from the window...

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Oh, that. That ain't nothin' to be afraid of, ma'am. Just ol Chief Bromden. That's all...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Is he one of the loonies?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: He can't hear you, Rose. He's just a big deaf an' dumb indian...

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Pssst! Hey Rose! There they are!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: They're sleeping, Miss. They're sleeping. An' we gotta keep it down so we don't disturb their sleep.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Are they dangerous when they're awake?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Oh, no, Miss. Not these loonies. These are nice guys. Nice guys.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Smells like piss. Is this real, Candy? Is this really real? I mean we are in an insane asylum, an' I wanna know how we got ourselves into this scene.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Shhh, please, Miss. Keep it down...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Ya know him, Mac. Ya remember, Chuck.

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Sure, I know Chuck. I know him.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Well, listen to this. He got mad at me one day. Boy, did he get mad at me. He took the light bulb, ya know. I thought he was going to cram it right up me, ya know. But he ate it. He ate the whole fucking light bulb.  Now, tell me! Is he crazy? Tell me! Is he crazy?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Well, Miss... I would say... I would say, yes. Yes, he's crazy.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Oh, I see. He was a very sick man. Very sick.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: That's what I told his mother. And she said I was crazy. Her son ate the whole fucking light bulb and she said I was crazy.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: I don't know anything about that, Miss. I would have to examine you first...

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Well, I'm running a risk by letting you in, Miss. You know I'm runnin' a risk of gettin' my black ass fired. If you understand what I mean...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Sure, she understands what you mean. She's not dumb. Why do you think Rose came to visit us? Rose is very interested in hospitals and hospital facilities. Aren't you, Rose?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: I'll be very glad to show you around, Miss...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Yeah, that's a good idea, Turkle. Why don't ya take Rose on a little tour of our facilities...

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: It's okay, Rose. You can go with him.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Oh yeah! Well if ya don't mind, I'll decide on my own date!

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Shit, Rose! What's there to decide? There's only four of us.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Whaddaya talkin' about? There's at least twenty guys in there. Let's wake 'em up and get this party on the road.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Now, Miss. What do you want with twenty zombies when you got a twenty gun salute looking you right in the face.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: You better believe it, you sweet little thing. You better believe it...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Don't you sweet talk me you ol' spook, you!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Oh, I'm all through talkin'. Now, let's just you an' me trip on down that hall.

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Go with him, Rose. Go with him.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Well, okay, but I just want to look at the facilities. That's all.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: That's all I'm going to show you.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: You crazy goons... shut up an' get outta here... Out! Out! Out!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Shit, it's the soo-per-visor come to fire my black ass.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Alla ya goons, get in here!

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: Oh, there you are, Mister Turkle.

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: The lights were flashing on and off, Mister Turkle.

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Cleanliness is a twenty-four-hour job, ma'am...

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: What are these men doing up wandering around?

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Ah guess the natives are restless, ma'am...

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: You've been drinking on the job again, haven't you, Mister Turkle!

Speaker: turkle
Dialogue: Ah, no, ma'am... well, yes, ma'am...  A man get awful lonely at night, if ya know what Ah mean, ma'am...

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: I want those men put back to bed, Mister Turkle!

Speaker: night supervisor
Dialogue: And you haven't heard the last of this!

Speaker: fredrickson
Dialogue: Christ, they even got my first grade report card here...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ellis ain't gonna hurt you... Ellis is nice... Nice Ellis... see the nice lady...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: There, see, nice lady touch Ellis...

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: It's time to hit the road, Mack...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: I jus' want you guys to have a good time... Are ya havin' a good time? You... you... good... good... Lez have some fun...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Ain'tcha havin' a good time...  Whadaya want? Ya wanna drink? A cigarette...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Ah-ah-ah-are y-y-y-you g-g-g-going t-t-t-to muh-muh-muh-marry her?

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Candy? Hell no, Billy, she's just a good friend, that's all...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Wu-wu-wu I-I-I-I th-th-think sh-sh sh-she's th-th-th-the ma-ma-ma-most bu-bu-bu-beautiful wu-wu-wu-woman in th-th-the whole world!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Go on, son, now's your chance...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: C-C-Candy, wu-wu-will y-y-you mu-mu marry me!

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Come on, you lovers, it's gettin' late...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: It's okay, kid. Everything it going to be okay... I'll come back an' getcha in a while... 'Kay...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Thank you, Mister Washington! Mister McMurphy, do you know where Billy is?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: You should have thought about that before you brought that woman in here!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: N-n-n-n-no, no, I du-du-du-didn't, I didn't!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: I don't want your mother to believe something like this but what am I to think?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Billy, that girl couldn't have pulled you in there forcibly...

Speaker: mcmurphy
Dialogue: Hey, Billy, stop cryin'. You don't have to cry... You ain't got nothin' to be ashamed of. She ain't gonna tell you mother... stop crying...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Put him in Doctor Spivey's office!

Speaker: washington
Dialogue: 'Kay, let's have the keys an' nobody get hurt!

Speaker: candy
Dialogue: Come on, come on, let's go!

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Get away from him! Don't you dare touch him!

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Big Ace... a lovely lady... another ace... an' a little trey, hey, hey, whadaya say... hit or sit?

Speaker: sefelt
Dialogue: McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped...

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: Is it true McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped yesterday?

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: No. Mister Harding, that is not true.

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Now, let's find you a place to sit, shall we, Mister McMurphy?

Speaker: scanlon
Dialogue: Yeah, that Gary Blinker is fulla shit...

Speaker: big nurse
Dialogue: Here now, you sit here... That's it...

Speaker: bromden
Dialogue: When I first came here I was so scared of being lost I had to holler so they could track me... I figured anything was better than being lost...
